TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi BrowserCapabilitiesCodeGenerator extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The class is used internally by the tool to parse .browser browser definition files and add browsers to the run-time collection of known browsers contained in the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class generates the source code for an assembly for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BrowserCapabilitiesFactory> class, which, at run time, produces request-specific <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase> objects to be publicly accessed through the ASP.NET intrinsic `Request.Browser` property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Used internally to create a new instance of .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Create() cil managed
abstract member Create : unit -> unit override this.Create : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Used internally to coordinate the behavior of this class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method first iterates through the "Browsers" folder. It then calls <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BrowserCapabilitiesCodeGenerator.ProcessBrowserFiles%2A>, which loads and parses the XML contained in a collection of browser-definition files and inserts the information contained therein into an internal collection of browsers. Then it calls an internal method which generates the source code compiles it, and registers it as an assembly in the global assembly cache for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BrowserCapabilitiesFactory> object. If necessary, this method then calls an internal method that restarts the Web server.

MemberSignature.Value: protected void ProcessBrowserFiles (bool useVirtualPath, string virtualDir);

Docs.param: to use a virtual path; otherwise, . The default is .
The path to the virtual directory that contains the browser-definition files. The default is .
Docs.summary: Loads and parses the XML contained in a collection of browser-definition files and inserts the information contained therein into an internal collection of browsers.
Docs.exception:
One of the browser-definition files does not have a root element named "browsers".
-or-
One of the browser-definition files fails to load.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Uninstall() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes the browser capabilities factory from the global assembly cache and deletes its strong name public key token file.
Docs.returns: if the browser capabilities factory was uninstalled from the global assembly cache; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method restarts the Web service. The browser capabilities factory is then removed from the global assembly cache, and its strong name public key token file is deleted. The Web service is then restarted again if the uninstall succeeds.

Docs.related: Working with Assemblies and the Global Assembly Cache
